title: Mother is jailed for killing her two sons after she was found with 'self-inflicted' stab wounds
text:
An Alabama mother has been placed in jail on murder charges for allegedly killing her two sons, authorities say.

The Cullman County Sheriff’s Office revealed that Sara Franco Tapia, 32, was booked on Monday with two counts of murder in relation to 3-year-old Alvaro Garcia and 9-year-old Taylor Garcia.

She is currently being held at the Cullman County Detention Center and has no bond.

Sara Franco Tapia (pictured) appears to have a self-inflicted stab wound in her chest and an injury on her neck after she was accused of killing her two sons

In the mugshot, Tapia can be seen with what authorities believe to be self-inflicted stab wounds on her chest and neck.

On October 12, authorities were called to Tapia’s Baileyton area home where they discovered the dead bodies of her two sons.

The emergency call came from the boys’ father.

3-year-old Alvaro Garcia (left) and 9-year-old Taylor Garcia (right) were found deceased inside their Alabama home on October 12

The siblings cause of death has not been revealed, but the local coroners office will run autopsies.

Authorities searched the area for alleged suspect before finding Tapia in a grassy field near their home.

A knife was recovered from the scene.

She was covered in stab wounds and cuts when authorities reached her.

Tapia was transported by helicopter to a north Alabama hospital where she was placed in intensive care and monitored by authorities.

Authorities arrived to the Garcia family's home (pictured) and found Tapia in a nearby grass field covered in injuries from 'self-inflicted' stab wounds

Before her booking, Tapia was in stable condition.

Sheriff Matt Gentry told the Cullman Tribune: ‘You never can prepare yourself in the 20 years I’ve been in law enforcement for children, for something bad to happen to children.’

He says there is no history of mental health concerns with Tapia.

‘You just can't cover up mean and evil,’ Gentry said.

Authorities only had limited contact with Tapia and were unable to fully question her.

‘There is a language barrier,' he told the Culllman Times.

While Tapia has not formally been convicted of the murder charges, the department has ruled out the father’s involvement with the case.

Sheriff Matt Gentry (pictured): 'You never can prepare yourself in the 20 years I’ve been in law enforcement for children, for something bad to happen to children'

The boys have other siblings and it is unclear where they were during the attack.

In a post, the Parkside Elementary School mourned the loss of one of its young students and advised that the family needed help with funeral costs.

‘Most of the visitors to our page probably know about the tragic events of Saturday afternoon that affected one of the families of our little school and took the life of one of our 4th grade students, Taylor Tapia Garcia and his 3 year old brother.’

‘Thank you, and please remember Tania, her dad, the rest of their family, Taylor and Tania's friends specifically, all the students and staff of Parkside that loved and adored these sweet children, and the community of Baileyton in your thoughts and prayers.’

The specific cause of death for Taylor Garcia (left) and Alvaro Garcia (right) have not been revealed, but they underwent autopsies at a local coroners office

Principal Orr of Parkside Elementary School said that students and staff are still processing the tragic incident.

‘It took a lot of tears and a lot of just sitting there for a while to try and come to terms with it,’ he said, ‘and I don’t think we’re at terms with it yet.’

School officials have brought in mental health professionals and school counselors to help children process their emotions.

Tapia’s daughter Tania has not returned to school yet.

‘We want to kind of set the tone for when she comes back, that we take care of her and wrap her in the love we have in the building,’ Orr said.

WAFF reports that the boys' funeral was held on October 18 at the Capilla de la Santa Cruz/Chapel of the Holy Cross in Albertville.
description: Sara Franco Tapia, 32, was jailed on two counts of murder after authorities arrived to her Baileyton, Alabama, home on October 12 and discovered her two sons dead inside
